page.title: 01GOOLE - A BRIEF RESUME
page.content: Goole was founded as a "Company Town" by the Aire and Calder Navigation Company as a terminus for their{canal. The area is flat, only a few feet above the tidal River Ouse. The two other rivers (Aire and Don) make the {town}almost an island which occupies about 25% of the block. The block is well served by rail, road, river and motorway links. The remaining land of the block is almost totally comprised of highly fertile arable land producing a variety of crops including wheat, barley, potatoes and sugar-beet. This area was formerly part of the old West Riding of Yorkshire but since 1974 has been in the administrative county of Humberside.
